example.eg: Look what a mess I've made of it; you can't possibly do worse!
example.egtrans: 你看我搞的烂摊子，你绝对不可能比我还差！

example.eg: Yesterday's food was bad, but today's is worse.
example.egtrans: 昨天的饭菜不好，今天的更差了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 更坏的, 更差的, 更糟糕的

example.eg: You can't possibly sing worse than me.
example.egtrans: 你不可能唱得比我还差。

example.eg: This project is worse than the last one.
example.egtrans: 这个项目比之前那个更繁重。

example.eg: That player is worse than me.
example.egtrans: 那个玩家的技术比我差。

example.eg: Things were bad, but he had survived worse.
example.egtrans: 情况是很不妙，不过他还经历过更糟糕的。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 更差的东西, 更糟糕的东西

example.eg: The television reception was bad.
example.egtrans: 电视接收效果不好。

example.eg: Smoking is bad for you.
example.egtrans: 吸烟有害你的健康。

example.eg: I like to think there are more good people than bad people in the world.
example.egtrans: 我认为世上好人比坏人多。

example.eg: Your pronunciation is bad - you need to practice.
example.egtrans: 你发音不准，需要多加练习。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不准确的, 不正确的, 不规范的

example.eg: The critic wrote a bad review of the performance.
example.egtrans: 那名批评家就表演写了一篇差评。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 差的, 不好的, 不利的

example.eg: I'm afraid I have some bad news for you.
example.egtrans: 我恐怕有些坏消息要告诉你。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 让人难受的, 让人沮丧的, 不幸的, 坏的

example.eg: The faulty one was part of a bad batch.
example.egtrans: 那个缺陷产品来自一个不合格的批次。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不合格的，有缺陷的，有问题的

example.eg: My uncle is so bad - always making rude jokes!  He was a bad child, and was always misbehaving.
example.egtrans: 我叔叔太坏了，总爱开一些粗鲁的玩笑！他以前是个坏孩子，总是胡来。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 行为不得体的，举止不文明的，坏的

example.eg: Take these painkillers if the pain becomes too bad.
example.egtrans: 如果疼痛变得剧烈，就服用这些止痛药。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 严重的, 糟糕的, 剧烈的

example.eg: His eyes got worse as he regularly read in bad lighting.
example.egtrans: 因为经常在光线不充足的环境下阅读，所以他的视力变差了。

example.eg: He was a bad workman, and whatever he mended soon broke again.
example.egtrans: 他是个拙劣的工匠，不管他修的是什么总是很快就又坏了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 技艺不佳的, 拙劣的

example.eg: Why is Britain so bad at tennis?
example.egtrans: 英国人为什么乒乓球打得这么糟？

example.eg: He has a bad heart.
I think these apples are bad.  They have been there for a month.
There was bad feeling between them.
The west coast is renowned for its bad weather.
There was a bad smell from the bin.
example.egtrans: 垃圾桶传来难闻的味道。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 难闻的, 令人不快的

example.eg: She had smallpox as a child and has a bad complexion because of it.
example.egtrans: 她小时的时候得过天花，因此皮肤就不太好看。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不美的, 不好看的, 有瑕疵的

example.eg: The comic's routine was full of bad language.
US: He had been paid with a bad check.
example.egtrans: 美式英语：发给他的工资支票是假的。

example.eg: Oh man, that is so bad! I really like it!
He was sacked and given a bad reference.
example.egtrans: 他被解雇了，获得的推荐也很差。

example.eg: The bullies beat him up bad.
example.egtrans: 霸凌者把他狠狠打了一顿。

example.eg: I need a haircut real bad but the hairdresser is shut.
We must take the bad with the good.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 坏事, 厄运, 倒霉事, 不好的东西

example.eg: Hell is reserved for the truly bad.
I'm sorry things have turned out badly for you.
example.egtrans: 现在的情况对你不利，我感到很抱歉。

example.eg: I play the piano very badly.
example.egtrans: 我弹钢琴弹得很差。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 拙劣地, 不好地, 差

example.eg: Two passengers were badly hurt in the crash.
example.egtrans: 两名乘客在事故中受了重伤。

example.eg: I want so badly to see you again!
example.egtrans: 我非常想再次见到你！

example.eg: The children behave badly when they're overtired.
example.egtrans: 孩子们过度疲劳时行为表现不良。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不良地, 邪恶地, 罪恶地

example.eg: The inmates at the Thai prison were treated badly.
example.egtrans: 泰国监狱的囚犯受到了残酷虐待。

example.eg: Ray felt badly about the accident he had caused.
Dan was so ill that he needed to go to the hospital.
example.egtrans: 丹病得很严重，需要去医院就医。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 有病的，不舒服的, 生病的

example.eg: The medication has a label on it that warns of ill effects.
example.egtrans: 这种药物的标签上写有副作用的警告。

example.eg: The weird hail storm in the middle of summer was interpreted as an ill omen by the superstitious townspeople.
example.egtrans: 迷信的镇民将仲夏时的怪异冰雹视为凶兆。

example.eg: After the market crash the business could ill afford bad publicity.
example.egtrans: 市场崩盘后，该企业经不起负面宣传。

example.eg: Karen ill deserves such a promotion.
example.egtrans: 凯伦不配得到这样的升职。

example.eg: The old man always wore ill fitting clothes.  We were ill informed by the insurance company.
example.egtrans: 那位老人总是穿着不合身的衣服。保险公司没有给我们提供充分的信息。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不适合地, 不恰当地

example.eg: The city had an ill reputation, but it was actually very nice.
example.egtrans: 这个城市名声不好，但实际上很不错。

dsense.name: ill
dsense.guideword: literary, dated (badly, unkindly) (书面语，过时用语)

example.eg: Why dost thou treat me ill?
example.egtrans: 你何以如此薄待我？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不礼貌地, 不友善地

example.eg: He wished every ill upon his enemy.
example.egtrans: 他希望敌人事事倒霉。

example.eg: The young people hope to bring an end to the ills of hunger and poverty.
example.egtrans: 年轻人希望终结饥饿和贫穷等不幸。

example.eg: I will be your wife for better or for worse.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 不管是好是坏, 不管怎么样, 不管结果如何

example.eg: The weather gradually got worse over the course of the day.
example.egtrans: 一天下来，天气逐渐变糟。

example.eg: The patient's condition is getting worse.
example.egtrans: 这位病人的情况正在恶化。

example.eg: If we keep using fossil fuels, global warming will get worse and worse.
example.egtrans: 如果我们继续使用化石燃料，全球变暖现象将会越来越严重。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 每况愈下, 越来越糟

example.eg: Since I bought that self-help book my life's gone from bad to worse.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 越来越坏, 越来越差

example.eg: Your cough will grow worse if you don't give up smoking.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 变得更糟, 越来越糟

example.eg: I told him that scratching at the rash would only make it worse.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使恶化, 使变得更差

dsense.name: take a turn for the worse

example.eg: His condition remained stable for three days, then suddenly he took a turn for the worse.
Most people are worse off now than they were before the stock market crashed.
example.egtrans: 大多数人现在的经济状况都比股市崩盘前更糟。

example.eg: Those people are no worse off than we are.
example.egtrans: 那些人并没有比我们不幸。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 更糟的是, 更不幸的是
